title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses the p_load() function of the pacman package to check if the tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If yes, they are then launched in R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)




The data set for this hands-on exercise is imported into the R environment using the read_csv() function of the readr package and stored as the R object, exam_data.
The tibble data frame, exam_data, has 7 columns and 322 rows.

exam_data = read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")




The ggplot() and geom_bar() functions in the ggplot2 package are used to plot a bar chart showing the breakdown of the data by the “RACE” variable.
From the bar chart, we can see that most of the students are Chinese, followed by Malay. A minority of students are Indian or other races.

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar()

title: ISSS608: Visual Analytics and Applications
text:
Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications!
In this webpage, I am going to share my visual analytics learning journey.





Credit: Prima Consulting UK

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses the p_load() function of the pacman package to check if the tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If yes, they are then launched in R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)




The data set for this hands-on exercise is imported into the R environment using the read_csv() function of the readr package and stored as the R object, exam_data.
The tibble data frame, exam_data, has 7 columns and 322 rows.

exam_data = read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")




The ggplot() and geom_bar() functions in the ggplot2 package are used to plot a bar chart showing the breakdown of the data by the “RACE” variable.
From the bar chart, we can see that most of the students are Chinese, followed by Malay. A minority of students are Indian or other races.

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar()
